item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, August 31, 2024 at 6:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need [video] (2022) (130 points | 24 comments)
2. Artifacts are now generally available (10 points | discuss)
3. My fake job in Y2K preparedness (18 points | 4 comments)
4. Lucee: A light-weight dynamic CFML scripting language for the JVM (30 points | 12 comments)
5. Nearly half of Nvidia's revenue comes from four mystery whales each buying $3B+ (28 points | 15 comments)
6. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (73 points | 16 comments)
7. Is my vision that bad? No, it's just a bug in Apple's Calculator (501 points | 273 comments)
8. What it's like take a train across America, a visual diary (36 points | 19 comments)
9. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (61 points | 17 comments)
10. Building Bubbletea Programs (99 points | 27 comments)
11. Rediscovering the Small Web (2020) (198 points | 47 comments)
12. Deepwater Sub Recovers Roman Battering Ram Used in Carthage in Punic Wars Battle (82 points | 13 comments)
13. Designing a Timeline for Mobile Video Editing (38 points | 7 comments)
14. Sisk – Lightweight .NET Web Framework (37 points | 26 comments)
15. Changes in Need for Uniqueness From 2000 Until 2020 (28 points | 18 comments)
16. About synchronous disk replication (60 points | 17 comments)
17. Texas State Police Gear Up for Expansion of Surveillance Tech (70 points | 44 comments)
18. AnandTech Farewell (2807 points | 567 comments)
19. CIEL Is an Extended Lisp (363 points | 87 comments)
20. Bresenham's Circle Drawing Algorithm (2021) (63 points | 19 comments)
21. Using Fibonacci numbers to convert from miles to kilometers and vice versa (315 points | 114 comments)
22. Iron as an inexpensive storage medium for hydrogen (115 points | 75 comments)
23. Wired Love: A Romance of Dots and Dashes (1880) (6 points | 1 comment)
24. Orphaning bcachefs-tools in Debian (157 points | 157 comments)
25. BaseX – a highly W3C compliant XQuery processor (71 points | 1 comment)
26. Carbon removal plant absorbs CO2 at 99,000 times the rate of all Earth's oceans (10 points | 9 comments)
27. Show HN: Supertree – interactive visualization of decision trees in Python (49 points | 7 comments)
28. The Great Vic Gravel Route: Crossing Victoria on Unsealed Roads (52 points | 24 comments)
29. Tumblr to move its half a billion blogs to WordPress (67 points | 68 comments)
30. 500 Python Interpreters (163 points | 26 comments)
